newsitem.title: USA: EU grain output seen falling in 1997/98-US attache.
newsitem.headline: EU grain output seen falling in 1997/98-US attache.

text.p: European Union total grain production is expected to fall 2.5 pct to about 198.9 million tonnes in 1997/98, down from 204 million tonnes in 1996/97, a U.S. attache in Brussels said in a report made public on Tuesday.

"This will lead to a continuation of relatively tight internal EU grain supplies and relatively volatile prices," the report said. "The current smaller crop prospects should not limit EU grain exports for 1997/98."

Total imports of grain by the EU are expected to increase slightly in 1997/98, reflecting corn imports necessary to meet CY 1997 trade concessions from the accession of Spain and Portugal, the report said. Total grain exports are forecast to only increase marginally due to the relatively tight internal EU grain situation.

"Depending upon world grain supplies and prices, the EU could be able to export grain with relatively small or no restitutions in 1997/98," the attache report said. The EU is forecast to meet its export subsidy commitments under the Uruguay Round for 1996/97 and 1997/98, the report said.
U.S. attache reports are not considered official USDA data.
